title: Authors and Citation
text: Athanasia Mo Mowinckel. Author, maintainer. Didac Vidal-Piñeiro. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mowinckel , Vidal-Piñeiro D (2026). ggsegGlasser: Glasser Atlas 'ggseg' Ecosystem. R package version 2.0.0, https://github.com/ggsegverse/ggsegGlasser.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggsegGlasser: Glasser Atlas for the 'ggseg' Ecosystem},   author = {Athanasia Mo Mowinckel and Didac Vidal-Piñeiro},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 2.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/ggsegverse/ggsegGlasser}, }

what: Glasser Atlas for the ggseg Ecosystem
title: Glasser Atlas for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: repository contains R package atlas data ggseg ggseg3d Glasser parcellation HPC. Glasser et al. (2016) Nature, volume 536, pages 171–178 pubmed

title: Glasser Atlas for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: recommend installing ggseg-atlases ggseg r-universe: can install released version ggsegGlasser CRAN : development version GitHub :
code: # Enable this universe options(repos = c(     ggsegverse = 'https://ggsegverse.r-universe.dev',     CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Install some packages install.packages('ggsegGlasser') install.packages("ggsegGlasser") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("LCBC-UiO/ggsegGlasser")

title: Glasser Atlas for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: basic example shows solve common problem:   Please note ‘ggsegGlasser’ project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.
code: library(ggsegGlasser) library(ggseg) #> Warning: package 'ggseg' was built under R version 4.1.1 #> Loading required package: ggplot2 library(ggplot2)  plot(glasser) +   theme(legend.position = "bottom",         legend.text = element_text(size = 9)) +   guides(fill = guide_legend(ncol = 7)) library(ggseg3d) library(dplyr)  ggseg3d(atlas = glasser_3d) %>%    pan_camera("right lateral")

what: ggsegGlasser: Glasser Atlas for the 'ggseg' Ecosystem — ggsegGlasser-package
title: ggsegGlasser: Glasser Atlas for the 'ggseg' Ecosystem — ggsegGlasser-package
text: Glasser multi-modal cortical parcellation (HCP) atlas 'ggseg' ecosystem. Provides unified 'ggseg_atlas' object 2D polygon geometry use 'ggseg'.

title: ggsegGlasser: Glasser Atlas for the 'ggseg' Ecosystem — ggsegGlasser-package
text: Maintainer: Athanasia Mo Mowinckel .m.mowinckel@psykologi.uio.(ORCID) Authors: Didac Vidal-Piñeiro d.v.pineiro@psykologi.uio.(ORCID)

title: Glasser Multi-Modal Cortical Parcellation (HCP) — glasser
text: Brain atlas Glasser cortical parcellation 361 regions based Human Connectome Project multi-modal parcellation. Contains 2D polygon geometry ggseg::geom_brain().

title: Glasser Multi-Modal Cortical Parcellation (HCP) — glasser
text: Glasser MF, Coalson TS, Robinson EC, Hacker CD, Harwell J, Yacoub E, Ugurbil K, Andersson J, Beckmann CF, Jenkinson M, Smith SM, Van Essen DC (2016). multi-modal parcellation human cerebral cortex. Nature, 536(7615):171-178. doi:10.1038/nature18933

title: Glasser Multi-Modal Cortical Parcellation (HCP) — glasser
code: glasser() #>  #> ── glasser ggseg atlas ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Type: cortical #> Regions: 361 #> Hemispheres: left, right #> Views: inferior, lateral, medial, superior #> Palette: ✔ #> Rendering: ✔ ggseg #> ✔ ggseg3d (vertices) #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> # A tibble: 362 × 3 #>     hemi
